description: Observations to Corporation of London in connection with  demolition of the existing buildings and erection of an office building (Use Class B1) with retail uses (Use Classes A1, A2, A3) at lower ground, ground and upper ground levels; operational development and enhancement of underground and mainline railway stations; together with associated works, including new and altered accesses, servicing and plant areas and parking facilities. (59,980 sq.m 10 storeys).
decision_conditions: INFORMATIVE:  The height of the proposed development on the site is constrained by policy relating to protecting strategic views of St Paul's Cathedral from Greenwich and Blackheath.  This ensures that these important views are not impacted upon by the proposal.  Officers are of the opinion that the design is of a high quality and relates well to the surroundings with a strong design rationale that should produce a functionally robust and visually attractive building.  Furthermore the scheme will improve rail services at the site.  The proposal will however, due to height constraints and topography, not have a visually significant impact upon the character of Islington.
